metadata.Title: CVE-2023-43804 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
urllib3 is a user-friendly HTTP client library for Python. urllib3 doesn't treat the `Cookie` HTTP header special or provide any helpers for managing cookies over HTTP, that is the responsibility of the user. However, it is possible for a user to specify a `Cookie` header and unknowingly leak information via HTTP redirects to a different origin if that user doesn't disable redirects explicitly. This issue has been patched in urllib3 version 1.26.17 or 2.0.5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-43804` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm6
python-pip-whl - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm6
python3-pip - 8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm6
No subscription required

python-urllib3 - 1.13.1-2ubuntu0.16.04.4+esm1
python3-urllib3 - 1.13.1-2ubuntu0.16.04.4+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> On focal and earlier, the python-pip package bundles python-urllib3 binaries when built. After updating python-urllib3, a no-change rebuild of python-pip is required. On jammy and later, python-urllib3 is bundled in the python-pip package and needs to be patched.

criterions.comment: python-pip package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.1-2ubuntu0.6+esm6').
python-urllib3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.1-2ubuntu0.16.04.4+esm1').
